result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Geneman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Must pay $100.00 per month towards restitution.
11/11/14 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE RESTITUTION TO BE AMENDED TO $1410.03.

06/02/2015 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS MINIMUM MONTHLY PAYMENTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $200.00 PER MONTH BEGINNING 06/15/2015 TOWARDS RESTITUTION.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).

timeConds.notes:
Must be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

06/02/2015 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT TO COMPLETE A MINIMUM OF 10 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE WORK PER WEEK.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber.
Consecutive to: Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

records.addlTxt: to Modify Conditions of Probation.
Review hearing at 10-06-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Joshua A Geneman in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miranda Simpkins appeared for DOC
Defendant relates re: payments and has started a new job;   Oct 8, 2015 is discharge date.   $30.47 restitution still owing.  Probation is not going to be extended today.  

Community service hours have not been completed. State requests 60 days jail for fail to complete community service.  Argument by Attorney Hinde;  State relates and requests 10 hours of community service hours per week.  Argument by Defendant and states is working hours at Perkins.  Court orders a minimun of 10 hours of community service per week.


Community Service coordinator to let Judge Boyle know if community service hours are complete  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Amended.
Original Restitution assessments erased on 11/12/14 due to Amended Restitution Order being filed.
$1410.03 Amended.
Probation review hearing on January 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Geneman in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State moves to amend the count 1 to 2 counts of 943.50(1m)(b) a class A misdemeanor. 
Defendant pleads guilty to the amended counts 1 and 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Parties agree to read in an uncharged case and a Stipulation will be filed at a later date. 
C-31 filed. 
State makes argument. Defense makes argument. 

Court relates and orders: 

STAYED:
Count 1: 30 days jail with huber.
Count 2: 30 days jail with huber consecutive to Count 1. 

IMPOSED: 
1 Year Probation - on each count.
$697.13 Restitution Per C-31. Must pay $100.00 per month. 
100 hours of Community Service Work to be completed within the first six months.
Must participate in Victim Offender Conferencing through the Restorative Justice Program. 
Costs.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence - on each count.  Probation review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
